summary: Inflow remittances through the Roshan Digital Account (RDA) reached $5.1 billion by the end of May, up from $4.9 billion at April's end, according to the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP). April saw remittances of $245 million, compared to $290 million in March and $250 million in February. The RDA offers innovative banking solutions for millions of Non-Resident Pakistanis (NRPs) and Pakistan Origin Card (POC) holders, facilitating banking, payment, and investment activities in Pakistan. The number of RDA accounts also increased to 575,000 by the end of May. Overseas Pakistanis invested $1.25 billion in Naya Pakistan Certificates, $1.6 billion in Naya Pakistan Islamic Certificates, and $45 million in Roshan Equity Investment. The RDA was introduced by the SBP to facilitate remittances and investments from overseas Pakistanis.
